titles.title: To authorize extension of time limitation for a FERC-issued hydroelectric license.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Power.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Commerce. H. Rept. 104-318.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 169.

action.text: Mr. Schaefer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Energy Production and Regulation.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 104-313.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 488.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 11/13/1995--Passed House amended. Authorizes the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, upon request of a certain licensee, to extend for a maximum of three consecutive two-year periods, the time required to commence construction of a specified hydroelectric project. Directs the Commission to reinstate any expired license for such project, effective June 1, 1995.
